016package de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.util;
017
018import static de.cuioss.tools.string.MoreStrings.isEmpty;
019import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertEquals;
020import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertFalse;
021import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNotNull;
022import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.fail;
023
024import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
025import java.lang.reflect.Method;
026import java.util.Collection;
027import java.util.Collections;
028import java.util.List;
029
030import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.impl.ExceptionHelper;
031import de.cuioss.tools.reflect.MoreReflection;
032import lombok.experimental.UtilityClass;
033
034@UtilityClass
035public class DeepCopyTestHelper {
036
037    /**
038     * To test the result of a deep copy function.
039     * <p>
040     * The main focus is to check if the copy is independent from the source and
041     * does not have any reference to the source.
042     * <p>
043     * To check the equality of the objects the equals method should be implemented
044     * correctly.
045     *
046     * @param source the source object
047     * @param copy   the result of the copy function
048     */
049    public static void testDeepCopy(Object source, Object copy) {
050        testDeepCopy(source, copy, Collections.emptyList());
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * To test the result of a deep copy function.
055     * <p>
056     * The main focus is to check if the copy is independent from the source and
057     * does not have any reference to the source. -> Deep Copy, instead of shallow
058     * copy
059     * <p>
060     * To check the equality of the objects the equals method should be implemented
061     * correctly.
062     *
063     * @param source           the source object
064     * @param copy             the result of the copy function
065     * @param ignoreProperties The top-level attribute names to be ignored
066     */
067    public static void testDeepCopy(Object source, Object copy, Collection<String> ignoreProperties) {
068        testDeepCopy(source, copy, null, ignoreProperties);
069    }
070
071    @SuppressWarnings("java:S2259") // owolff: False positive: assertions are not considered here
072    private static void testDeepCopy(Object source, Object copy, String propertyString,
073            Collection<String> ignoreProperties) {
074
075        assertNotNull(ignoreProperties, "ignore-properties my be empty but never null");
076        // first check: check equals
077        assertEquals(source, copy);
078        if (null == source) {
079            return;
080        }
081
082        final var currentPropertyString = determinePropertyString(propertyString);
083
084        for (final Method accessMethod : MoreReflection.retrieveAccessMethods(source.getClass(), ignoreProperties)) {
085            var propertyName = MoreReflection.computePropertyNameFromMethodName(accessMethod.getName());
086            try {
087                var resultSource = accessMethod.invoke(source);
088                var resultCopy = accessMethod.invoke(copy);
089
090                // check for null
091                // No sense in checking Strings, primitives and enums
092                if (!checkNullContract(resultSource, resultCopy, currentPropertyString, propertyName)
093                        || resultSource.getClass().isPrimitive() || resultSource.getClass().isEnum()
094                        || String.class.equals(resultSource.getClass())) {
095                    continue;
096                }
097                if (!checkForList(resultSource, resultCopy, currentPropertyString, propertyName)) {
098                    if (MoreReflection.retrieveWriteMethod(source.getClass(), propertyName, resultSource.getClass())
099                            .isEmpty()) {
100                        continue;
101                    }
102
103                    assertFalse(resultSource == resultCopy, "deep copy failed with: " + currentPropertyString
104                            + propertyName + " (" + resultSource.toString() + ")");
105                    testDeepCopy(resultSource, resultCopy, currentPropertyString + propertyName,
106                            Collections.emptyList());
107                }
108            } catch (IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e) {
109                fail("invoke method " + accessMethod.getName() + "failed: "
110                        + ExceptionHelper.extractCauseMessageFromThrowable(e));
111            }
112
113        }
114    }
115
116    private boolean checkNullContract(Object resultSource, Object resultCopy, String currentPropertyString,
117            String propertyName) {
118        // check for null
119        if (null != resultSource) {
120            if (null == resultCopy) {
121                fail("property " + currentPropertyString + propertyName + " differs: " + resultSource.toString()
122                        + " != null");
123            }
124        } else if (null == resultCopy) {
125            return false;
126        } else {
127            fail("property " + currentPropertyString + propertyName + " differs: null != " + resultCopy.toString());
128        }
129        return true;
130    }
131
132    private boolean checkForList(Object resultSource, Object resultCopy, String currentPropertyString,
133            String propertyName) {
134        if (!(resultSource instanceof List)) {
135            return false;
136        }
137        List<?> resultSourceList = (List<?>) resultSource;
138        for (var i = 0; i < resultSourceList.size(); i++) {
139            testDeepCopy(resultSourceList.get(i), ((List<?>) resultCopy).get(i),
140                    currentPropertyString + propertyName + "[" + i + "]", Collections.emptyList());
141        }
142        return true;
143
144    }
145
146    private static String determinePropertyString(String propertyString) {
147        if (isEmpty(propertyString)) {
148            return "";
149        }
150        return propertyString + ".";
151    }
152}
